channel.title: NEED HELP! extend class8.java
channel.description:

trying to add many new customs to my project and am at a stand still until i get this resolved..
please help :(

public void loadItemDefintion(int id) {

    switch (id) {
        case 995:// item id
            class8.blah = someNumber;
            break;

}

item.title: NEED HELP! extend class8.java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

tyb97:

^A switch can improve efficiency, because in an else-if setup, it has to check all the choices until one checks for true, in a switch, it goes directly to the correct choice.

It can improve performance, ONLY in large groups (5+). Anything less, and the number of bytecode instructions necessary to get the switch block to work is greater than those required in a simple if-else.

Also, as I stated before, if-else blocks and switch blocks work the same. switch blocks don’t “go directly to the correct choice”. It tests each one, just like a switch statement.

To the JVM

if (anInt == 0) {
    doSomething0();
}
else if (anInt == 1) {
    doSomething1();
}
else if (anInt == 2) {
    doSomething2();
}
else {
    leave();
}

is exactly the same as

switch (anInt) {
    case 0:
        doSomething0();
        break;

    case 1:
        doSomething1();
        break;

    case 2:
        doSomething2();
        break;

    default:
        leave();
        break;
}

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP! extend class8.java
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

^A switch can improve efficiency, because in an else-if setup, it has to check all the choices until one checks for true, in a switch, it goes directly to the correct choice.

item.title: NEED HELP! extend class8.java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

h1 sk1ller:

You can’t rep++ remove from sig, and ofc the if statments wont work on a switch statment like that the one with the lunar staff ints was right.[/quote][quote=“tyb97, post:26, topic:421700”]A switch is 10 times better than an else if statement IMO. I try using all my codes with switch statements, they are much cleaner. And of course you can’t add if (i==… because the case: is what the item id’s are :fp:

if-else statements work exactly the same way as a switch block. For larger decisions (5+) I would use a switch. Anything less is an if-else.

@OP: You’re not extending Class8, or calling the load method anywhere else in the client.

Protip: A better way to load the data (instead of hard-coding it like a MSCPer) would be either XML or using raw binary file(s) (XML: Human-readable, bulkier; Binary: Machine-readable, lighter).

Read full topic

if this is my class8_Sub1

[code]import sign.signlink;
import java.io.*;

final class Class8_Sub1 {
public static void items(int i) {
Class8 c = Class8.method198(i);

switch(i) {

}//ends switch
}//ends void
}//ends file[/code]

Like this,

[code]

*

*/
break;
[/code][/quote]
